EngLawName: Organizational Regulations for the Management Committee of the Wage Arrears Payment Fund of the Ministry of Labor
name: 勞動部積欠工資墊償基金管理委員會組織規程

articles.content: The Regulations are enacted in accordance with Paragraph 6, Article 28 of the Labor Standards Act.

A committee member shall serve a two-year term that may be renewed upon completion of the term. However, a member representing a government authority or a group shall relinquish or assume his/her position on the committee in conjunction with his/her full-time position.

The Committee shall have an executive secretary, a position that is to be held concurrently by the director of the Department of Labor Standards and Equal Employment of the Ministry of Labor.  Staff members of the Committee will be appointed by the MOL. The Ministry of Labor is in charge of overall planning regarding the Committee’s administration and management, while relevant competent authorities are to oversee the personnel, budgets and final accounts, property management, and other affairs of the Committee.

In principle, the Committee will hold a meeting every six months; extraordinary meetings will be held if they are considered necessary.  All meetings are to be convened by the chairperson.
All committee members shall attend the meeting in person and may not have another person attend the meeting on his/her behalf.
Each meeting must be attended by more than half the members, and any resolution reached at the meeting must be approved by over two-thirds of the members in attendance.
Representatives from the Bureau of Labor Insurance, Ministry of Labor and other relevant authorities may be invited to a meeting convened by the Committee.
Committee member positions are unpaid positions; however, non-MOL members shall be paid concurrent serving fees and transportation fees in accordance with regulations.
The Regulations shall become effective on the date of promulgation.
